result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanner R Emond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Tanner R Emond in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Court sentences defendant to: $443.002 costs, $199.88 Restitution has been paid, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, 5 days sentence credit,

Defendant, Tanner R Emond came in on authorized warrant. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin, requested cash bond. Statement by defendant regarding missed court. Case reset to Oct. 19, 2016 at 2:45 Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
